register.name: PMCCFILTR
register.gui_name: Performance Monitors Cycle Count Filter Register
register.description: Determines the modes in which the Cycle Counter, PMCCNTR, increments.

bitField.name: P
bitField.description: Privileged filtering bit. Controls counting in EL1. If EL3 is implemented, then counting in Non-secure EL1 is further controlled by the NSK bit.

bitField.name: U
bitField.description: User filtering bit. Controls counting in EL0. If EL3 is implemented, then counting in Non-secure EL0 is further controlled by the NSU bit.

bitField.name: NSK
bitField.description: Non-secure EL1 (kernel) modes filtering bit. Controls counting in Non-secure EL1. If EL3 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: NSU
bitField.description: Non-secure EL0 (Unprivileged) filtering. Controls counting in Non-secure EL0. If EL3 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: NSH
bitField.description: Non-secure EL2 (Hyp mode) filtering bit. Controls counting in Non-secure EL2. If EL2 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

register.name: PMCCNTR
register.description: Holds the value of the processor Cycle Counter, CCNT, that counts processor clock cycles. See for more information...

bitField.name: CCNT
bitField.description: Cycle count. Depending on the values of PMCR.

register.name: PMCCNTR_64
register.description: Holds the value of the processor Cycle Counter, CCNT, that counts processor clock cycles. See for more information...

bitField.name: CCNT
bitField.description: Cycle count. Depending on the values of PMCR.

register.name: PMCEID0
register.gui_name: Performance Monitors Common Event Identification register 0
register.description: Defines which common architectural and common microarchitectural feature events in the range 0x000 to 0x01F are implemented. If a particular bit is set to 1, then the event for that bit is implemented.

bitField.name: ID_31_0
bitField.description: PMCEID0[n] maps to event n. For a list of event numbers and descriptions, see .

register.name: PMCEID1
register.gui_name: Performance Monitors Common Event Identification register 1
register.description: Defines which common architectural and common microarchitectural feature events in the range 0x020 to 0x03F are implemented. If a particular bit is set to 1, then the event for that bit is implemented.

bitField.name: ID_63_32
bitField.description: PMCEID1[n] maps to event (n + 32). For a list of event numbers and descriptions, see .

register.name: PMCNTENCLR
register.gui_name: Performance Monitors Count Enable Clear register
register.description: Disables the Cycle Count Register, PMCCNTR, and any implemented event counters PMEVCNTR<n>. Reading this register shows which counters are enabled...

bitField.name: C
bitField.description: PMCCNTR disable bit. Disables the cycle counter register.

register.name: PMCR
register.description: Provides details of the Performance Monitors implementation, including the number of counters implemented, and configures and controls the counters.

bitField.name: IMP
bitField.description: Implementer code. This field is RO with an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED value.

bitField.name: IDCODE
bitField.description: Identification code. This field is RO with an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED value.

bitField.name: N
bitField.description: Number of event counters. A RO field that indicates the number counters implemented. A value of 0b00000 in this field indicates that only the Cycle Count Register PMCCNTR is implemented.

bitField.name: LC
bitField.description: Long cycle counter enable. Determines which PMCCNTR bit generates an overflow recorded by PMOVSR[31].

bitField.name: DP
bitField.description: Disable cycle counter when event counting is prohibited.

bitField.name: X
bitField.description: Enable export of events in an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED event stream.

bitField.name: D
bitField.description: Clock divider.

bitField.name: C
bitField.description: Cycle counter reset. This bit is WO.

bitField.name: P
bitField.description: Event counter reset. This bit is WO.

bitField.name: E
bitField.description: Enable.

register.name: PMEVTYPER0
register.description: Configures event counter n, where n is 0 to 30.

bitField.name: P
bitField.description: Privileged filtering bit. Controls counting in EL1. If EL3 is implemented, then counting in Non-secure EL1 is further controlled by the NSK bit.

bitField.name: U
bitField.description: User filtering bit. Controls counting in EL0. If EL3 is implemented, then counting in Non-secure EL0 is further controlled by the NSU bit.

bitField.name: NSK
bitField.description: Non-secure EL1 (kernel) modes filtering bit. Controls counting in Non-secure EL1. If EL3 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: NSU
bitField.description: Non-secure EL0 (Unprivileged) filtering. Controls counting in Non-secure EL0. If EL3 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: NSH
bitField.description: Non-secure EL2 (Hyp mode) filtering bit. Controls counting in Non-secure EL2. If EL2 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: MT
bitField.description: Multithreading.

bitField.name: evtCount
bitField.description: Event to count. The event number of the event that is counted by event counter PMEVCNTR<n>.

register.description: Configures event counter n, where n is 0 to 30.

bitField.name: P
bitField.description: Privileged filtering bit. Controls counting in EL1. If EL3 is implemented, then counting in Non-secure EL1 is further controlled by the NSK bit.

bitField.name: U
bitField.description: User filtering bit. Controls counting in EL0. If EL3 is implemented, then counting in Non-secure EL0 is further controlled by the NSU bit.

bitField.name: NSK
bitField.description: Non-secure EL1 (kernel) modes filtering bit. Controls counting in Non-secure EL1. If EL3 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: NSU
bitField.description: Non-secure EL0 (Unprivileged) filtering. Controls counting in Non-secure EL0. If EL3 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: NSH
bitField.description: Non-secure EL2 (Hyp mode) filtering bit. Controls counting in Non-secure EL2. If EL2 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: MT
bitField.description: Multithreading.

bitField.name: evtCount
bitField.description: Event to count. The event number of the event that is counted by event counter PMEVCNTR<n>.

register.name: PMINTENCLR
register.gui_name: Performance Monitors Interrupt Enable Clear register
register.description: Disables the generation of interrupt requests on overflows from the Cycle Count Register, PMCCNTR, and the event counters PMEVCNTR<n>. Reading the register shows which overflow interrupt requests are enabled...

register.name: PMUSERENR
register.description: Enables or disables User mode access to the Performance Monitors.

bitField.name: ER
bitField.description: Event counter read trap control:

bitField.name: CR
bitField.description: Cycle counter read trap control:

bitField.name: SW
bitField.description: Software increment write trap control:

bitField.name: EN
bitField.description: Traps EL0 accesses to the Performance Monitors registers to Undefined mode:

register.name: PMXEVCNTR
register.gui_name: Performance Monitors Selected Event Count Register
register.description: Reads or writes the value of the selected event counter, PMEVCNTR<n>. PMSELR.SEL determines which event counter is selected.

bitField.name: PMEVCNTR_n
bitField.description: Value of the selected event counter, PMEVCNTR<n>, where n is the value stored in PMSELR.SEL.

register.name: PMXEVTYPER
register.gui_name: Performance Monitors Selected Event Type Register
register.description: When PMSELR.SEL selects an event counter, this accesses a PMEVTYPER<n> register. When PMSELR.SEL selects the cycle counter, this accesses PMCCFILTR.

tcf:enumItem.description: When read, means that the PMEVCNTR<n> event counter interrupt request is disabled. When written, has no effect.

tcf:enumItem.description: When read, means that PMEVCNTR<n> has overflowed. When written, clears the PMEVCNTR<n> overflow bit to 0.

tcf:enumItem.description: When read, means the cycle counter has not overflowed. When written, has no effect.
tcf:enumItem.name: When_read_means_the_cycle_counter_has_not_overflowed

tcf:enumItem.description: When read, means the cycle counter has overflowed. When written, sets the overflow bit to 1.
tcf:enumItem.name: When_read_means_the_cycle_counter_has_overflowed

tcf:enumItem.description: When read, means that PMEVCNTR<n> has not overflowed. When written, has no effect.
tcf:enumItem.name: When_read_means_that_PMEVCNTR_n_has_not_overflowed

tcf:enumItem.description: When read, means that PMEVCNTR<n> has overflowed. When written, sets the PMEVCNTR<n> overflow bit to 1.
tcf:enumItem.name: When_read_means_that_PMEVCNTR_n_has_overflowed

tcf:enumItem.description: No action. The write to this bit is ignored.

tcf:enumItem.description: If PMEVCNTR<n> is enabled and configured to count the software increment event, increments PMEVCNTR<n> by 1. If PMEVCNTR<n> is disabled, or not configured to count the software increment event, the write to this bit is ignored.
tcf:enumItem.name: If_PMEVCNTR_n_is_enabled_and_configured_to_count_the_software_increment_event_increments_PMEVCNTR_n_by_1

tcf:enumItem.description: EL0 reads of the PMXEVCNTR and PMEVCNTR<n>, and EL0 read/write access to the PMSELR, are trapped to Undefined mode if PMUSERENR.EN is also 0.
tcf:enumItem.name: EL0_reads_of_the_PMXEVCNTR_and_PMEVCNTR_n_and_EL0_read_write_access_to_the_PMSELR_are_trapped_to_Undefined_mode_if_PMUSERENR

tcf:enumItem.description: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.
tcf:enumItem.name: This_control_does_not_cause_any_instructions_to_be_trapped

tcf:enumItem.description: EL0 reads of the PMCCNTR are trapped to Undefined mode if PMUSERENR.EN is also 0.
tcf:enumItem.name: EL0_reads_of_the_PMCCNTR_are_trapped_to_Undefined_mode_if_PMUSERENR

tcf:enumItem.description: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.
tcf:enumItem.name: This_control_does_not_cause_any_instructions_to_be_trapped

tcf:enumItem.description: EL0 writes to the PMSWINC are trapped to Undefined mode if PMUSERENR.EN is also 0.
tcf:enumItem.name: EL0_writes_to_the_PMSWINC_are_trapped_to_Undefined_mode_if_PMUSERENR

tcf:enumItem.description: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.
tcf:enumItem.name: This_control_does_not_cause_any_instructions_to_be_trapped

tcf:enumItem.description: EL0 accesses to the Performance Monitors registers are trapped to Undefined mode, unless enabled by one of PMUSERENR.{ER, CR, SW}.

tcf:enumItem.description: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped. Software can access all PMU registers at EL0.
